Surplus.definition: an amount that remains when a use or need is satisfied b

1 a.definition: an amount that remains when a use or need is satisfied

sub_terms.b: an excess of receipts over disbursements
sub_terms.c: the value of assets after subtracting liabilities

2.definition: an excess of the net worth of a corporation over the par value of its capital stock compare

capital surplus.definition: all surplus other than earned surplus

earned surplus.definition: the surplus that remains after deducting losses, distributions to stockholders, and transfers to capital stock accounts

paid-in surplus.definition: surplus resulting from the sale of stock at amounts above par
